name: Bukchon
summary: Quiet hanok lanes with polished galleries and tea spots.
best_time: 08:30-11:00 for soft light and fewer groups
how_to_get: Anguk Station (Line 3), Exit 2, then 10-minute uphill walk
must_do: Walk Gahoe-dong alley loop and stop at a hanok tea house
hidden_tip: Use side streets near Bukchon-ro 11-gil for quieter views
do_not: Avoid loud calls and door-front photos in residential lanes

name: Seongsu
summary: Creative warehouse district with fashion pop-ups and coffee labs.
how_to_get: Seongsu Station (Line 2), Exit 3, walk toward Yeonmujang-gil
must_do: Pair one flagship store visit with a specialty cafe
hidden_tip: Weekdays before noon are much easier for popular lines
do_not: Do not plan too many stops, queues can eat your schedule
budget: Mid to high depending on shopping

name: Hongdae
summary: Youthful street energy, live busking, and late-night food options.
best_time: 18:00-23:30 for music and night street mood
must_do: Watch buskers near main square then move to side alley bars
hidden_tip: Use Yeonnam side streets for slower pace between peak blocks
do_not: Skip main strip restaurants at 19:00-20:30 unless you pre-book
